I tested at 29 weeks.  My doctor said (most places recommend not to eat before the test or fast)  but you can eat a light breakfast.  He said it won't hurt the test.  It's meant to show if you have diabetes in the first place.. So I ended up eating a big bowl of honey nut cherrios (has a decent amount of sugar!)  and I ended up passing.  So enjoy yourself a nice small breakfast or lunch before you go.
